conclusion: Analyze figures and use wave properties to determine direction and speed.
Figure 1 shows a wave with a wavelength, the distance between consecutive crests is the wavelength.
Wavelength λ is 4 m from Figure 1.
Figure 2 shows the position of the particle at x=2 m as a function of time.
Period T is 4 s as the particle moves to maximum displacement at t=3 s.
Wave speed v is calculated as 1 m/s using v = λ/T.
Wave travels in positive x-direction as particle moves in positive y-direction at t=2 s.
Direction of wave propagation is positive x-direction and wave speed is 1 m/s.
